channel.title: Turned my Kicksecure into Whonix-Host?
channel.description:
Hello, I am still at seting up my system for whonix which is as debian host and Whonix in KVM. When I install Kicksecure and then Tor after a reboot, I get a warning message about whonix-host and that it is experimental and therefore insecure. What I did: -install debian 11 -install KVM and set up Whonix -install grub-live and set default-live -install Kicksecure -torify all apt reps -install Tor-browser on Host
I could reproduce this with a second installation. Is my system now insecure because of that? Can you please help me on that again?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Turned my Kicksecure into Whonix-Host?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix-Host doesn’t exist at time of writing.

Whonix – 29 Sep 21

Whonix-Host Operating System Live ISO, Whonix-Host Installer

Upcoming Host Operating System (In Development)

sigme:

And how do I avoid that without leaving out a step?

The abstract answer is “complete the development of Whonix-Host”.

Read full topic

item.title: Turned my Kicksecure into Whonix-Host?
item.dc:creator: sigme
item.description:
Hello,
thanks for those links.
What I couldnt find now: Is this it desired behaviour that Kicksecure turns into Whonix-host just like that?
And how do I avoid that without leaving out a step?

Sorry if my questions feel quite dumb to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Turned my Kicksecure into Whonix-Host?
item.dc:creator: sigme
item.description:
Hello,
I am still at seting up my system for whonix which is as debian host and Whonix in KVM.
When I install Kicksecure and then Tor after a reboot, I get a warning message about whonix-host and that it is experimental and therefore insecure.
What I did:
-install debian 11
-install KVM and set up Whonix
-install grub-live and set default-live
-install Kicksecure
-torify all apt reps
-install Tor-browser on Host

I could reproduce this with a second installation.
Is my system now insecure because of that? Can you please help me on that again?

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
